paragraphs.content: Chapter 33
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 33

paragraphs.content: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.

paragraphs.content: O LORD, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.

paragraphs.content: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.
paragraphs.contentHtml: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.

paragraphs.content: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.

paragraphs.content: The LORD is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.

paragraphs.content: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD is his treasure.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the Lord is his treasure.

paragraphs.content: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.

paragraphs.content: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.

paragraphs.content: The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.

paragraphs.content: Now will I rise, saith the LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now will I rise, saith the Lord; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.

paragraphs.content: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.

paragraphs.content: And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.

paragraphs.content: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?
paragraphs.contentHtml: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

paragraphs.content: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;

paragraphs.content: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.

paragraphs.content: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.

paragraphs.content: Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.

paragraphs.content: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.

paragraphs.content: But there the glorious LORD will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But there the glorious Lord will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.

paragraphs.content: For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king; he will save us.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord is our judge, the Lord is our lawgiver, the Lord is our king; he will save us.

paragraphs.content: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.

paragraphs.content: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.
